SEARCH
Package sh.brane.rpc

Interface Brane.Reader

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Brane
Enclosing interface:
Brane
public static sealed interface Brane.Reader extends Brane
Read-only client for blockchain queries.

Reader provides access to all read operations without transaction signing capability. This is the appropriate client type when you only need to query blockchain state, execute read-only contract calls, or subscribe to events.

Read-Only Guarantee

A Reader instance guarantees that no state-modifying transactions can be sent. This makes it safe to use in contexts where you want to prevent accidental writes, such as:

  • Analytics and monitoring applications
  • Block explorers and indexers
  • Read-only API endpoints
  • Testing and debugging tools

Creating a Reader


 // Via static factory (simplest)
 Brane.Reader reader = Brane.connect("https://eth.example.com");

 // Via builder (with configuration)
 Brane.Reader reader = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth.example.com")
     .chain(ChainProfiles.MAINNET)
     .retries(5)
     .buildReader();

Available Operations

All methods inherited from Brane are available:

  • Balance queries: Brane.getBalance(Address)
  • Block queries: Brane.getLatestBlock(), Brane.getBlockByNumber(long)
  • Transaction queries: Brane.getTransactionByHash(Hash), Brane.getTransactionReceipt(Hash)
  • Contract calls: Brane.call(CallRequest), Brane.call(CallRequest, BlockTag)
  • Log queries: Brane.getLogs(LogFilter)
  • Gas estimation: Brane.estimateGas(TransactionRequest)
  • Access list creation: Brane.createAccessList(TransactionRequest)
  • Simulation: Brane.simulate(SimulateRequest)
  • Batching: Brane.batch()
  • Subscriptions: Brane.onNewHeads(Consumer), Brane.onLogs(LogFilter, Consumer)
Since:
0.1.0
